Connecting you with experts and resources on clean energy technologies at the Department of Energy.

  • Connect with a Scientist

How it Works

  • Send a Message

    Fill out one of the three forms above to send us a message.

  • Find an Expert

    Our tech transfer officers route your inquiry to the relevant experts.

  • Connect

    Once an expert is found, they'll reach out with answers to your questions.

FAQ

  1. 1. What is the Clean Energy Investment Center (CEIC)?

    The Department of Energy launched the center to provide investors a single location for information and resources on clean energy technologies, including connecting with technical experts and gathering data on the new technologies and projects. Our goal is to increase access to the information needed to make informed decisions.  

  2. 2. What is the Laboratory Partnering Service?

    We understand that it can be difficult to find answers in a large agency such as the Department of Energy that has facilities across the country, including 17 national laboratories located across the country. Our service solves that problem. Now, you only visit one location, and then we will connect you with an expert that can provide answers.

  3. 3. Are there costs associated with the Laboratory Partnering Service?

    It is free to submit questions and receive preliminary feedback and information.

Speak to a Scientist

If you want to learn more about a specific technology or science, we have a vast network of scientists with deep knowledge and we are here to help you connect to them.

  • Used to route your inquiry to a particular lab

Partner with a Lab

If you want to understand what capabilities our labs have to use them for your research or partner with a lab on scientific discovery, let us know what you are looking to explore.

Other Questions

If you have other questions or inquiries about the Department of Energy’s Clean Energy portfolio, let us know how we can help you.
